metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7550 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
The load_multiboot function in hw/i386/multiboot.c in Quick Emulator (akaQEMU) allows local guest OS users to execute arbitrary code on the QEMUhost via a mh_load_end_addr value greater than mh_bss_end_addr, whichtriggers an out-of-bounds read or write memory access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7550` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-system-data - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-system-gui - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu9').
